thread.title: Dorval warns of door-to-door heating scam
thread.title_full: Dorval warns of door-to-door heating scam | CTV Montreal News

author: CTV Montreal
title: Dorval warns of door-to-door heating scam
text:
The City of Dorval is warning people of a new scam.

A company has been calling or going door-to-door, claiming it was contracted by the city to check on heating systems.
Dorval said it hasn't authorized any inspections of this kind – and in fact, never authorize businesses to go door-to-door. It is prohibited with the exception of some charity organizations.         
The City of Dorval issued a warning to citizens on its Facebook page Tuesday, saying a number of residents reported suspicious visits from solicitors at their homes.

People in other West Island cities have also reported similar encounters.

They say the scam involves someone calling or going door-to-door and claiming to be contracted by the city to verify the heating system in the home.

They insist on looking at the furnace or hot water tank.

Some residents say the solicitor is aggressive, trying to push the homeowner to buy a new one.

Similar incidents have occurred across Canada and in some U.S. states.
Dorval spokesperson Sebastien Gauthier said they are working with police, adding that what concerns them the most is that the salespeople are falsely claiming to be contracted by the city.
“If they have any doubts about the good word of that company, we advise they can call the city just to make sure that we haven't given out an authorization,” he said. “We’ve never done it so the bet would be that it's false.”

Gauthier advises calling your local public security or the police if you feel you've been approached with a scam.
